title: Sheffield baseball coach's death ruled an accident
content:
The death of Jared Mothershed has been ruled an accident by the Colbert County Coroner.
The Sheffield community is still mourning the death of the 27-year-old coach.
Mothershed was an assistant football coach at Sheffield High School and the head baseball coach.
The school system said they were notified that Mothershed had died early Saturday morning.
Colbert County Coroner Carlton Utley said based on lack of evidence for any other cause of death they are ruling Mothershed's death an accidental discharge of a gun.
Mothershed was on paid administrative leave from the school pending a personnel investigation, according to the superintendent.
Mothershed was buried Monday in the Shoals.
